full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 42 of 247 170 LBUVMAX2 Visoski - direct
1 Q. While Ms. Drescher puts that up, will you please describe once again what we see in this photograph, Mr. Visoski.
2 A. That's the middle of the aircraft or where actually the emergency exits are located. When you say describe it --
3 Q. What we're seeing in the foreground and the background, the jurors weren't able to see the photograph when you were describing it.
4 A. Oh, I'm sorry. Gotcha. I thought I just explained it. I'm going to repeat myself.
5 So this is the round couch, round divan that was in the middle of the aircraft. And then as you see in the photo, the red couch or divan, which was Mr. Epstein's office and which -- to the right side of that, which is not in the photo, there was a large desk. And then in the foreground, way in the back are the two captain's chairs that are actually across from the master bed in the back of the aircraft.
6 MS. COMEY: We can take that down.
7 Thank you, Ms. Drescher.
8 Q. What, if any, barrier was there between the pilots and the passengers on the Boeing 727?
9 A. On the Boeing, each compartment had its own doors, so you can seclude each compartment or even the cockpit from the passengers.
10 Q. During flight in the Boeing 727, was the cockpit door opened or closed?
11 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
12 DOJ-OGR-00017404
